title: Entrata API
text: Overview Authentication Endpoints Methods Status Codes Rate Limiting Throttling Error Handling Retry Request Headers Request Body Request Parameters Response Headers Response Body Examples

title: Entrata API
text: Entrata API provides programmatic access read write data Entrata Platform Service (PaaS), retrieves various property marketing data, lease resident details, . API organized around RPC protocols, authenticates users username password generated Entrata platform. user specific client can access API particular company. order make API explorable possible, Entrata provides “swagger-like” experience documentation able view endpoints, methods, parameters, examples, even test API’s functionality read types web-services. functionality returns live data. API supports XML JSON format. use-case dealing JSON. response match request format specified Content-Type HTTP header. URL endpoint depends upon call made. example, making getCustomers service, post https://[subdomain].entrata.com/api/customers. subdomain client specific. Please note unless stated otherwise, dates times used API assumed Mountain Time (MST MDT).

title: Entrata API
text: Entrata API uses basic authentication. username password passed Authorization header HTTP request. username password ones used log Entrata platform. perform authentication R, package utilizes httr2 library’s req_auth_basic() function pass username password API handle encoding credentials.

title: Entrata API
text: Entrata API number endpoints can accessed. endpoint number methods can called. methods specific endpoint used perform specific actions data. example, properties endpoint methods like getProperties, getPropertyUnits, sendFloorplans. important note requests made Entrata API HTTP POST requests. means requests must made using POST method, even operation read-(.e. GET) operation. endpoint-specific methods (confused HTTP methods) come play. method action want perform data. example, want get list properties, use getProperties method properties endpoint passing necessary parameters specific method.

title: Entrata API
text: Another unique aspect Entrata API always returns 200 status code, regardless success failure request. determine request successful , must inspect response body. response body contains error message code, request successful. actual HTTP status code associated error located response body instead typical HTTP status code. response body contain status object code message field. code field contain HTTP status code message field contain message.

title: Entrata API Request — entrata
text: function sends HTTP request Entrata API. Use function base template create HTTP requests Entrata API. function used functions package create requests Entrata API.

title: Entrata API Request — entrata
code: entrata(   endpoint = NULL,   method = NULL,   method_version = "r1",   method_params = list(NULL),   ua = user_agent(),   verbosity = NULL,   perform = FALSE,   extract = perform,   enable_retry = FALSE,   timeout = NULL,   dry_run = FALSE,   progress = FALSE,   config = config::get("entrata"),   ... )

title: Entrata API Request — entrata
text: endpoint Entrata API Endpoint send request . Default NULL. See details available endpoints. method Entrata API Method use request. confused HTTP request method (.e. GET, POST), method must method available Entrata API specified endpoint. default value depends whether endpoint parameter provided, available default value first method listed endpoint. endpoint specified, NULL used method request body. See details available methods endpoint details structure request. method_version Entrata API Method Version use request. Default "r1". endpoints multiple versions method. version provided string. See details information structure request available versions endpoint method. method_params List parameters use request body's "method" object. Default empty list. parameters provided named list names parameter names values parameter values. See details information structure request available parameters endpoint method. default value depends whether endpoint parameter provided, available default value empty list. endpoint specified, NULL used method request body. ua User Agent string use request. Default use user_agent(). verbosity much information print? wrapper around req_verbose() uses integer control verbosity: 0: output 1: show headers 2: show headers bodies 3: show headers, bodies, curl status messages. Use with_verbosity() control verbosity requests affect directly. perform Logical value indicating whether perform request. Default FALSE. FALSE, function return request object without performing request. TRUE, function perform request return response object. extract Logical value indicating whether extract response. Default value perform. TRUE, function extract response object return . FALSE, function return response object . enable_retry Logical value indicating whether enable request retry. Default FALSE. TRUE, function enable request retry default retry settings. FALSE, function enable request retry. timeout Numeric value indicating request timeout seconds. Default NULL. provided, function set request timeout provided value seconds. dry_run Logical value indicating whether perform dry run request. Default FALSE. TRUE, function perform dry run request performing actual request (perform set, return request object without performing request). progress Logical value indicating whether show progress request. useful long running requests. Default FALSE. TRUE, function show progress request. config Entrata API Configuration Values list. Default use config::get("entrata") retrieve configuration values config.yml configuration file. configuration values include following keys: username, password, base_url. See details. ... Additional arguments pass request object.

title: Entrata API Request — entrata
text: httr2::request() object Entrata API request.

title: Entrata API Request — entrata
text: function creates request Entrata API using httr2 package. Specifically, function creates HTTP POST request Entrata API appending request's URL path provided endpoint, assigning POST HTTP Method, adding necessary authentication, populating necessary request headers, deriving request's body using provided method name params parameters. See details. raw format base template request:   Authorization header Basic authentication header provided username password body JSON encoded data object using provided method params:

title: Entrata Leases — entrata_leases
text: application_id Optional. Integer value application ID customer_id Optional. Integer value customer ID lease_status_type_ids Optional. Integer vector lease status type IDs lease_ids Optional. Integer vector lease IDs scheduled_ar_code_ids Optional. Integer vector scheduled AR code IDs unit_number Optional. Character value unit number building_name Optional. Character value building name move_in_date_from Optional. Date value move-date move_in_date_to Optional. Date value move-date lease_expiring_date_from Optional. Date value lease expiring lease_expiring_date_to Optional. Date value lease expiring move_out_date_from Optional. Date value move-date move_out_date_to Optional. Date value move-date include_other_income_leases Optional. Logical value include income leases resident_friendly_mode Optional. Logical value include resident friendly mode include_lease_history Optional. Logical value include lease history information include_ar_transactions Optional. Logical value include AR transactions pagination_page_number Pagination page number. Default 1 pagination_page_size Number items per page. Default 500 include_pagination_links Logical value include pagination links response. Default FALSE ... Additional parameters pass request property_ids Required. Integer vector property IDs

title: Prepare Pre-Lease Report Parameters — prep_pre_lease_report_params
text: function prepares parameters required generating pre-lease report Entrata.

title: Prepare Pre-Lease Report Parameters — prep_pre_lease_report_params
code: prep_pre_lease_report_params(   latest_report_version = mem_get_latest_report_version("pre_lease"),   property_group_ids = mem_get_property_ids_filter_param(),   period_start_date = "09/01/2024",   period_type = "date",   summarize_by = "unit_type",   group_by = "unit_type",   consider_pre_leased_on = "33",   charge_code_detail = 1,   space_options = "do_not_show",   additional_units_shown = "available",   combine_unit_spaces_with_same_lease = 0,   consolidate_by = "no_consolidation",   arrange_by_property = 0,   subtotals = list("summary", "details"),   yoy = 1,   ... )

title: Prepare Pre-Lease Report Parameters — prep_pre_lease_report_params
text: latest_report_version character string representing latest version pre-lease report. Defaults fetching latest version. property_group_ids list property group IDs include report. period_start_date start date reporting period. Defaults "09/01/2024". period_type type period report. Defaults "date". summarize_by level summarize report. Defaults "unit_type". group_by level group report. Defaults "unit_type". consider_pre_leased_on string representing pre-leased date. Defaults "33". charge_code_detail integer charge code details. Defaults 1. space_options string representing space options. Defaults "do_not_show". additional_units_shown string representing additional units shown. Defaults "available". combine_unit_spaces_with_same_lease integer indicating whether combine unit spaces. Defaults 0. consolidate_by string indicating consolidation options. Defaults "no_consolidation". arrange_by_property integer indicating whether arrange property. Defaults 0. subtotals list subtotals include report. Defaults c("summary", "details"). yoy integer indicating whether include year--year data. Defaults 1. ... Additional parameters report.

title: Prepare Pre-Lease Report Parameters — prep_pre_lease_report_params
text: list parameters pre-lease report.

title: Request Error Helpers — request_error

title: Request Error Helpers — request_error
text: resp httr2::response() object

title: Request Error Helpers — request_error
text: res_err_body() - Error message string. res_is_err() - Logical value indicating whether response error. res_err_retry() - Logical value indicating whether request retryable.

title: Request Error Helpers — request_error
text: Entrata API unique always returns 200 status code, regardless success failure request. determine request successful , must inspect response body. response body contains error message, can assume request successful.

title: Request Error Helpers — request_error
text: res_err_body() - Extracts error code message response body. Used body argument httr2::req_error(). res_is_err() - Determines response error. used is_error argument httr2::req_error(). res_err_retry() - Determines request retried based response's error code.

title: Request Retry Helpers — request_retry
text: Helper functions httr2::req_retry(). functions used conjunction req_retry() function provide additional information retry behavior request. particularly necessary working entrata_reports() functions call /reports endpoint's getReportData method since method returns "queue id" must used check status report generation via call /queue endpoint's getQueueStatus method passing "queue id" parameter.

title: Request Retry Helpers — request_retry
text: resp httr2::response() object

title: Request Retry Helpers — request_retry
text: req_should_retry() - Logical value indicating whether request retried. req_retry_is_transient() - Logical value indicating whether request transient retried. req_retry_backoff() - backoff time seconds. req_retry_after() - time wait retrying request.

title: Request Retry Helpers — request_retry
text: httr2::req_retry() function alters HTTP request httr2::req_perform() automatically retry case "transient" error. useful working APIs may experience temporary issues can resolved retrying request.

title: Request Retry Helpers — request_retry
text: req_should_retry() - Determines request retried based response's status code. req_retry_is_transient() - Determines request transient retried (applicable /queue endpoint's getQueueStatus method). req_retry_backoff() - Determines backoff time request retry seconds. req_retry_after() - Determines time wait retrying request based response headers.
